channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jamie Dimon wants to see wellness, nutrition and saving money added to America’s high school curriculum
item.description: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon believes the function of education should be changed to give students a livelihood and prepare them for real life.

item.description: They shouldn’t let the Democratic nominee outrun her record and her past, especially on this.

item.description: The corruption of our pop culture is linked to the corruption of our politics, which is leading us into tyranny.

item.title: Wizz Air proposes 300% bonus for its CEO following a ‘parade of black swans’
item.description: Jozsef Váradi's pay is a third of what it was in 2019 as the airline battles several crises.

item.title: Arizona Democratic campaign office damaged by gunfire
item.description: Someone fired shots at a Democratic Party campaign office in a Phoenix suburb, causing damage but no injuries, authorities said.

item.title: We Let the Libertine Tyrants Get Away with It
item.description: During Covid, the self-governing people of this nation allowed our highest moral aspirations to be manipulated by freaks like Jay Varma.

item.description: A newfound vision for American health care presents the Republican Party with a ripe opportunity to drive change and bipartisanship in a divided era.

item.description: Billionaire donor Alex Soros, son of financier George Soros, hosted Democratic vice presidential candidate Tim Walz at his New York City home.

item.title: 2,000 workers at Hawaii’s biggest hotel go on strike
item.description: More than 10,000 hotels workers across the U.S. went on strike on Labor Day weekend, with most ending after two or three days.

item.title: Trump briefed on 'real and specific threats' from Iran to assassinate him, campaign says
item.description: Former President Trump was briefed Tuesday about “real and specific threats" from Iran to assassinate him, according to his campaign team.

item.title: American company says Mexico president expropriated its $1.9 billion crocodile-filled quarries on the Caribbean coast
item.description: U.S. quarry company said the Mexican government carried out a de facto expropriation of its properties on Mexico’s Caribbean coast.

item.description: Inspectors hired by the U.S. Department of Agriculture have been threatened in Mexico for refusing to certify deceptive shipments in recent years.
